means: 用无线电波发送，发出信息

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含"送出，发送，传送"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: send, deliver, dispatch, forward, ship, transmit
means: send ： 普通最常用词，含义广。指把人或物由一地送往另一地，而不涉及事物的内容或 送的方式。
deliver ： 指把信件、包裹等物寄发出去或交到某地，或直接交与某人，着重发送这一行为。
dispatch ： 指为特殊目的而发送或派遣，强调紧急或快速。
forward ： 指经过其他人或手段把东西转送给某人。
ship ： 把通过水运、陆运或空运等方式运送东西。现常指商业上的运货，或将物品托运。
transmit ： 指将文件、消息等的内容或类似的东西发至某地或传达给他人。

sentence.Network_cn: 要了解这些产品的详细信息，请寄来标明HB/FF字样的明信片。

jx.jx_en_mean: cause someone to be knocked violently off balance or to the ground

lj.lj_ly: he sent word that he was busy.

jx.jx_en_mean: order or request that (something) be sent to one

lj.lj_ly: you can send away for the recipe.

jx.jx_en_mean: expel a student from a university

lj.lj_ly: you're going to get sent down for possessing drugs.
lj.lj_ls: 你将会因拥有毒品而被判处监禁。

lj.lj_ly: Bainbridge sent down 25 overs and finished with 5 for 44.
lj.lj_ls: 贝恩布里奇投球25轮，跑动5次，积44分。

jx.jx_en_mean: submit material to be considered for a competition or possible publication

lj.lj_ly: don't forget to send in your entries for our summer competition.
lj.lj_ls: 别忘了给我们的夏季竞赛投来你的参赛作品。

jx.jx_en_mean: another way of sayingsend away for above
instruct someone to go; arrange for someone's departure

lj.lj_ly: she sent him off to a lecturing engagement.
please take a moment or two to send off a cheque to a good cause.
lj.lj_ls: 请抽出一点时间为一项崇高事业寄发一张支票。

jx.jx_en_mean: transmit mail or luggage to a further destination or in advance of one's own arrival
jx.jx_cn_mean: 转寄；（人到达前）先行发送（邮件，行李）

lj.lj_ls: 公司以书面形式发布了股票信息。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English sendan, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch zenden and German senden

encyclopedia.content: 1. 电影《我的女友是机器人》插曲，演唱者：清竜人2. 功能向窗口发送指定的消息并立即执行相应的事件处理程序。

entry.def: When you send someone something, you arrange for it to be taken and delivered to them, for example by post.

example.ex: Myra Cunningham sent me a note thanking me for dinner...
example.tran: 迈拉·坎宁安给我寄了张便笺感谢我招待的晚餐。

example.ex: I sent a copy to the minister for transport...
example.tran: 我给交通部长发送了一份副本。

entry.def: If you send someone somewhere, you tell them to go there.

example.ex: Inspector Banbury came up to see her, but she sent him away...
example.tran: 班伯里巡官过来看她，却被她打发走了。

example.ex: He had been sent here to keep an eye on Benedict.
example.tran: 他被派到这儿监视贝内迪克特。

entry.tran: 把…送进(学校或监狱);安排…去
entry.def: If you send someone to an institution such as a school or a prison, you arrange for them to stay there for a period of time.

example.ex: It's his parents' choice to send him to a boarding school, rather than a convenient day school...
example.tran: 把他送到寄宿学校而非一家就近的走读学校是他父母的决定。

example.ex: You're saying they are sending too many people to prison?
example.tran: 你是说他们把太多人关进了监狱？

entry.tran: (通过无线电波或电流)发射，发送,传送(信号)
entry.def: To send a signal means to cause it to go to a place by means of radio waves or electricity.

example.ex: The transmitters will send a signal automatically to a local base station...
example.tran: 发射台会自动将信号发射到地方基站。

example.ex: ...in 1989, after a 12-year journey to Neptune, the space probe Voyager sent back pictures of Triton, its moon.
example.tran: 太空探测器“旅行者”号在历经 12 年的飞行后于 1989 年飞临海王星，发回了其卫星海卫一的照片。

entry.def: If something sends things or people in a particular direction, it causes them to move in that direction.

example.ex: The explosion sent shrapnel flying through the sides of cars on the crowded highway...
example.tran: 爆炸后飞溅出的炸弹碎片洞穿了拥堵在公路上的车辆车身。

example.ex: He let David go with a thrust of his wrist that sent the lad reeling...
example.tran: 他手腕猛一用力推开戴维，让这小伙子打了个踉跄。

entry.def: To send someone or something into a particular state means to cause them to go into or be in that state.

example.ex: My attempt to fix it sent Lawrence into fits of laughter.
example.tran: 我试着修理它，却让劳伦斯乐得前仰后合。

example.ex: ...before civil war and famine sent the country plunging into anarchy...
example.tran: 在内战和饥荒让这个国家陷入一片混乱之前

sentences.sentence: "The explosion sent the car flying in the air"
"He directed all his energies into his dissertation"

Sentence.sentence: And she makes a little extra money by sending stories to newspapers in the States.
Facebook then attempts to make money by selling their data to advertisers that want to send targeted messages.
But this vote of confidence in Oprah sends a troubling message at precisely the time when American universities need to do more to advance the cause of reason.
With far less controversy, colleges could send messages about canceled classes, delayed buses, campus crises or just the cafeteria menu.

More than paradise lost, a perishing rain forest could trigger a domino effect - sending winds and rains kilometers off course and loading the skies with even greater levels of greenhouse gases - that will be felt far beyond the Amazon basin.

sentences.en: I have thought about it; I'll send you.
sentences.cn: 我考虑过了, 我将派你去。

sentences.en: He was asked to send a telegram.
sentences.cn: 他被叫去送一封电报了。

sentences.en: He sent word that he would not be able to come.
sentences.cn: 他给我捎信说, 他不能来了。

means.word_mean: 用无线电波发送; 发出信息

sentences.en: Just before I left Singapore, I sent them a telegram.
sentences.cn: 在离开新加坡前我给他们发了一封电报。

jushi.english: She sent to inquire after you.
jushi.chinese: 她派人去打听你的健康状况。

jushi.english: She sent to say that she was safe and well.
jushi.chinese: 她送来消息说她安然无恙。
